FuncDef:
The mpls te link administrative group command sets a value for the link administrative group on an interface.
The undo mpls te link administrative group command deletes the configuration.
By default, the value of the link administrative group is 0x0.
CLIs: undo mpls te link administrative group

ParaDef.Info:
Sets a value for the link administrative group.
The value is a hexadecimal integer ranging from 0x0 to 0xFFFFFFFF. Each of the 32 bits in a value indicates an attribute, and each attribute occupies one bit.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The link administrative group is a 32-bit vector representing a set of link attributes. It works with the affinity for the system to determine the link that is used to set up an MPLS TE tunnel.
Configuration Impact
If the value of the link administrative group is changed using the command, the new value takes effect only for new LSPs, not for existing LSPs that have been set up before the new value is set.
Precautions
The command needs to be run only on the outbound interface of a link through which a TE tunnel passes.
